sentences.english: I realized then how much work Ault would be for me.
sentences.chinese: 我意识到，在奥尔特我有多少功课要做。

sentences.english: During my stay in bed, some of them came to see me and helped me with my lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我住院期间，一些同学来探望我，并帮我补习功课。

sentences.english: In peripheral equipment sticked hang "homework manipulate guidance".
sentences.chinese: 在周边设备上贴挂“功课操纵指引”。

sentences.english: The bell ring after we have finished our work.
sentences.chinese: 我们做完功课后，铃响了。

sentences.english: After supper, Cliff spread out his books before him to start reviewing his lessons.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭后克里夫把书本摊在面前开始复习功课。

sentences.english: It changed depending on my age, and the weather. You spent a lot of time helping me do my homework.
sentences.chinese: 你花很多时间教我功课。

sentences.english: I have taken physical exercise; now I must go at my lesson.
sentences.chinese: 我已经体育锻炼过了，现在得温习功课。

sentences.english: Write down the major life lessons you have learned so you can share them with others.
sentences.chinese: 将你所学到的主要人生功课写下来，使你能与人分享。

sentences.english: My secret communion with God is the place where I learn the great lessons concerning God's will.
sentences.chinese: 在与神相交的隐密处，我学到有关神旨意的伟大功课。

sentences.english: In addition to my classwork I had two jobs.
sentences.chinese: 除了做课堂功课之外，我还打了两份工。

sentences.english: What was your best subject in college? English.
sentences.chinese: 大学时你哪门功课最好？英语。

sentences.english: Tom didn't get promoted because he goofed off all the time and never did his homework.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆没有升级，因为他老是游手好闲，不做功课。

sentences.english: Helen: Well, if you do something wrong, you could say ‘I didn’t finish my work, so I have to face the music.’
sentences.chinese: 就是说“我没做完功课，所以我得硬着头皮挨训了”。

sentences.english: Harry is below average in his lessons and Jim is about up to average.
sentences.chinese: 哈利的功课在中等以下，吉姆的功课刚达一般水平。

sentences.english: Harry is below average in his lessons and Jim is about up to average.
sentences.chinese: 哈利的功课在中等以下，吉姆的功课刚达一般水平。

definition: diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
